entry.et: Middle English, from Old English hæt; akin to Old High German huot head covering hood

def.dt: :a covering for the head usually having a shaped crown and brim
:a distinctive head covering worn as a symbol of office
:an office, position, or role assumed by or as if by the wearing of a special hat wore many hats in her career
:not disclosed :secret kept the news under his hat
:to furnish or provide with a hat
:in an attitude of respectful humility have to go hat in hand to apologize

entry.et: probably from the former practice of rewarding the feat with the gift of a hat

def.dt: :the retiring of three batsmen with three consecutive balls by a bowler in cricket
:the scoring of three goals in one game (as of hockey or soccer) by a single player
:a series of three victories, successes, or related accomplishments scored a hat trick when her three best steers corralled top honors People

entry.et: from the gold braid worn on the cap

def.dt: :a hat with brim turned up to give a 3-cornered appearance
:a hat with brim turned up on two sides and worn either front to back or sideways
:a conical-shaped usually straw hat worn especially to protect the head from the heat of the sun
:a wide-brimmed hat with a large soft crown called also ten-gallon hat

entry.et: from an alleged incident in which a pedestrian's hat was crushed by a low-flying plane

def.dt: :to fly low in an airplane in a reckless manner :hedgehop
:a protective hat made of rigid material (as metal or fiberglass) and worn especially by construction workers
:a conservative who is intolerant of opposing views
